Coordinator, Youth Mental Health

Company Name North Western Melbourne Primary Health Network (NWMPHN) Company Location Parkville, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 51 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Commissioned Primary Health Services

  • Full-Time ongoing role
  • $90k + super with the additional benefit of salary packaging
  • Partner with us to play a key role in the development and delivery of Youth Mental Health Services across our catchment area


About us


We are North Western Melbourne Primary Health Network (NWMPHN), Victoria's largest independent, locally governed and run, not-for-profit PHN, dedicated to improving primary health care within our community. NWMPHN looks to a collaborative mental health care model that encourages different sectors to work together to provide complementary services and mutual support.


About the role


We are passionate about improving primary care services to the Youth Population in Melbourne's North West. Reporting to the Director, Mental Health and Wellbeing, the\xa0Coordinator, Youth Mental Health\xa0will play a key role in the development and improvement of the primary youth mental health services in our catchment. Key responsibilities will include supporting effective procurement of services, day to day contract management, engaging with various community stakeholders, and supporting workforce development and capacity building in both mainstream and Aboriginal organisations.


About you


If you are passionate about developing and improving primary mental health services for young people in your local community and have a demonstrated ability to undertake meaningful and multifaceted engagement with community stakeholders, apply now to join our friendly team!


What will you bring to the role?


  • Tertiary qualifications in mental health, a relevant discipline, or equivalent knowledge and experience
  • 3-5 years of relevant experience in mental health, public health or a related discipline including a minimum of 3 years' direct experience working with young people
  • Demonstrated ability to develop and maintain quality relationships with stakeholders, including the government, mental health services, consumers and carers
  • Project Management expertise


For more information please download the position description from our careers site. The successful applicant will be required to undertake a National Police Record Check, and must have a valid Working With Children's Check.


Applicants from Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander background are encouraged to apply.


To apply for this job go to: https://nwmphn.org.au/working-with-us/careers-with-nwmphn/ and enter reference 4326245 .

Applications close 10 September 2018

834795661:
[

SENIOR CIVIL ENGINEER/ PRINCIPAL CIVIL ENGINEER – WATER INDUSTRY

Company Name CMP Consulting Group Pty Ltd Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 69 views

Job description

CMP Consulting Group is one of Victoria’s leading water sector engineering consultants delivering projects across Australia. We provide multidisciplinary engineering and construction services to private and public sector clients.


CMP is passionate about our clients, projects and people. We have a reputation for providing innovative solutions and high-performing teams for projects on every element of the water cycle for urban, rural and industrial water applications.

\xa0

About the Role


We are currently seeking an enthusiastic Civil Engineer/Senior Civil Engineer with 10 years' plus experience to join our growing team at CMP in Melbourne.


This role presents a great opportunity to gain further experience working within the water industry and providing engineering solutions for a broad range of water related infrastructure.

\xa0\xa0

The position is full time and you will be supported with ongoing learning, development and training opportunities, and encouraged to develop your career.


In this role your responsibilities could include:

  • Hydraulic analysis and design of water, sewage, stormwater and recycled water systems including pump stations, pipelines, sewers, reservoirs and treatment plants.
  • Preparation of detailed design drawings and specifications for construction.
  • Optioneering, cost estimating and report writing. Construction supervision and contract management.
  • 2D and 3D drafting using AutoCAD and Civil 3D.
  • Team leadership, project management, asset management, risk assessments, client secondments, client management and business development.
  • Opportunities for structural or other specialist engineering in line with your interests.

\xa0

About the Candidate


We are seeking a highly motivated self-starter, with the desire to progress their career in a technically driven multidisciplinary setting, with the following key attributes:

  • Passionate about water engineering and client service.
  • Attention to detail and high-quality outcomes.
  • Excellent written communication and report writing skills.
  • Proven ability to work well within and lead a multidisciplinary team.
  • Flexible in your approach to challenges, and able to develop good relationships with internal and external stakeholders/clients.
  • Reliable, with a high integrity.

\xa0

Essential Criteria


  • Degree in Civil or Environmental Engineering.
  • At least ten years of experience in a professional engineering role, preferably in the water industry.

\xa0

What we offer at CMP


CMP is a growing and agile company and provides an exciting opportunity for young professional engineers to develop a well-rounded experience in water engineering and business development.


The benefits of working at CMP include:

  • An empowering and supportive culture that fosters diversity.
  • A friendly and fun working environment.
  • A high value on staff safety, health and wellbeing.
  • Opportunities for flexible working arrangements.
  • Excellent career opportunities to work on some of Melbourne’s most exciting projects.
  • A diverse range of projects that cover the full life cycle of the water sector from the water capture, transfer systems, treatment and disposal, renewable energy and recycled water.

\xa0

Applications should include a cover letter and CV.\xa0\xa0Please forward applications to sozturk@cmpgroup.com.au


Australian Citizenship or Permanent Residency essential.


Applications close 21st September 2018

Your role in the Tiffany holiday season

In Your Role As a Christmas Casual You Will
  • Deliver the Tiffany Experience - a personalized & luxury customer service experience whilst achieving exceptional sales
  • Maintain efficiency in a fast paced environment at the most wonderful time of the year.

Cricket Australia (CA) is one of the nation’s premier sporting bodies and the peak body for cricket in this country, providing a dynamic yet challenging work environment. Operating within the sports and entertainment industry, CA is responsible for overseeing and promoting cricket on a national level.

An exciting new opportunity is now available for an experienced and motivated Digital Product Owner – Fan Experience to join our Digital team. In this full-time role you will report to the Digital Portfolio Manager – Fan Experience and be accountable for leading the ongoing development of the portfolio of MyCricket Apps.

Specifically, You Will Be Responsible For
  • Ensuring a roadmap of features is developed, maintained and prioritised in alignment with business priorities and customer needs
  • Documenting new product features or improvements through the creation of user stories and definition of acceptance criteria
  • Establishing and maintaining a feedback loop with customers
  • Provide metrics and dashboards on the performance of products
  • Use analytics and customer insights to inform new product development and growth experiments
  • Showcase product enhancements to key stakeholders at the completion of each sprint
Essential

You will be successful in this role by establishing and maintaining strong relationships with key stakeholders and influential users. This is a fantastic opportunity to join the highly successful Digital team. To be successful in your application, you will have:

Knowledge of Lean Start-up and Growth Hacking methods
  • Experience working in an Agile environment
  • Skill in developing digital products
  • Strong communication and stakeholder management skills
  • Ability to build effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders
Desirable

  • A background playing sport in a club environment
  • A passion for cricket

Cricket Australia we work flexibly, offer a competitive salary package and extensive employee benefits including, salary packaging, gym access and discounts with our corporate partners.

We are committed to providing a safe environment for children across Australian Cricket, and we also offer a flexible work environment for employees. Compliance & Audit Tech Officer

Company Name APA Group Company Location Thomastown, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 18 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • 12 Month Contract
  • Leading Gas and Pipeline infrastructure company
  • Thomastown, VIC


Bring your energy! APA Group is one of Australia’s leading energy infrastructure businesses. As a part of the APA team, you’ll join a group of passionate professionals who work safely, and responsibly to deliver Australia’s energy.

As one of Australia’s ASX top 50 organisations we offer career and personal development opportunities, work-life balance, discounts, incentives and wellbeing programs.

Best of all, we are a bunch of great people to work with!

We now have an exciting opportunity available for Compliance and Audit Technical Officer to join our Capital Delivery team in Thomastown on a fixed term basis for 12 months.

Reporting to the Project Manager you will play a key role to facilitate compliant work processes and practices in the capital works department to ensure compliance to operation, HSE and regulatory requirements.

On a day to day basis, your responsibilities will include:
  • Assisting in the development of a field audit schedule of the operational functions of the business to monitor compliance to work procedures
  • Conducting field audits as required
  • Developing and communicating compliance and risk related information to Networks personnel as required
  • Developing a schedule of in-field visits/observations to determine procedural compliance gaps
  • Providing training/education as required to Networks personnel/contractors
  • Promoting a safe work place and high performance
  • Supporting the development of technical training and assessment systems within Networks to ensure Networks personnel/contractors are competent in performing key functions
  • Supporting and demonstrating continuous improvement to achieve compliant outcomes

To excel in this position you will have the following skills, experience, qualifications and attributes:

Mandatory
  • Ability to communicate well and maintain sound business relationships at all levels.
  • Ability to monitor and control a number of issues simultaneously and identify priorities
  • Ability to work effectively as part of a team and independently
  • High attention to detail
  • Good report writing skills
  • Ability to interpret complex technical information
  • Ability to use a range of computer software and information systems including word processing, spreadsheets, data bases and statistical analysis packages
  • General understanding of risk and compliance
  • Ability to understand and interpret legislation, regulations, codes of practice and standards applicable to key aspects of the business.
  • Tertiary qualifications (Certificate IV) in a relevant discipline or equivalent.


Preferred
  • Knowledge of gas network’s operations and sound knowledge of the energy industry
  • Experience or an understanding of gas network related procedures and processes
  • Experience in auditing, investigation and report writing
  • Advanced Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline

With a strong focus on achieving results, a collaborative working style and a values-based culture, APA offers you a career opportunity like no other!

If this sounds like a company and team that you’d like to be a part of we’d love to hear from you! Submit your application (covering letter and CV) by pressing the “Apply” button below before the closing date of 17 September 2018.

Applicants must be eligible to work in Australia to be considered.

APA Group is not accepting submissions from recruitment agencies for this role.

Industry

  • Oil & Energy

Employment Type

Contract

Job Functions

  • Engineering
  • Information Technology

The Role

Job description

About the Team


The Customer Experience and Transformation team is one of Capgemini’s fast growing advisory practices. We are responsible for working alongside our clients on strategic issues relating to Digital Strategy, transforming their IT capability to achieve commercial benefits and produce best in class digital products. Due to continued success we are currently looking for a Mobile/Front End Architect to join our collaborative and high performing team.


About the Role


As part of the CXT team you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of Australia’s largest and most complex digital initiatives. Many of our clients are household names and you’ll often have the chance to see the success of your work directly reflected in the community and, at times, praised by the media. This role will be primarily based in Sydney yet our clients are located across Australia and South-East Asia. As part of the team you’ll get the chance to visit multiple locations in addition to work across a variety of industries, across a portfolio of exciting projects, ability to travel is a must.


About You


We are looking for commercially-minded leaders who love being challenged and building lasting relationships with clients. Strong knowledge of business and digital trends is crucial to the success of this role. Ultimately you will use your expertise of these trends to help build digital products that will drive business solutions for clients.


Specifically, you may also bring experience in at least two of the following:


  • Define technical solutions, high-level architecture for Mobile Applications
  • Develop cross/multi-platforms (iOS, Android and Windows) mobile application using Xamarin framework or Web Application development using ASP.Net
  • Transform business requirements to technical specifications
  • Experience working with IQuery, JQueryMobile, Angular JS, Knockout JS or Backbone.js
